text: it's difficult enough when we lose these
brave Americans in battles overseas it
is horrifying
that they should come under fire at an
army base on American soil it is a
tragedy for Arizona and a tragedy for
our entire country we may never
understand what leads anybody to
terrorize their fellow human beings like
this these kinds of terrible tragic
events I have been with too much
regularity
the majority of those who died today
were children beautiful little kids
between the ages of five and ten years
old these are men and women who were
going to work
doing their job protecting all of us
they're patriots and they know the
dangers of serving abroad but when
they're at their home base they need to
feel safe we don't yet know what
happened tonight but obviously that
sense of safety has been broken once
again at some point we as a country will
have to reckon with the fact that this
type of mass violence does not happen in
other advanced countries we are not the
only country on Earth that has people
with mental illnesses or want to do harm
to other people and there are some steps
we could take not to eliminate every one
of these mass shootings but to improve
the odds that they don't happen as
frequently this massacre is therefore a
further reminder of how easy it is for
someone to get their hands on a weapon
that lets them shoot people in a school
or in a house of worship or a movie
theater or in a nightclub and we have to
decide if that's the kind of country we
want to be
